children.description:
To provide you with a list of popular restaurants in the most romantic city of Europe, I need to first determine which city is considered the most romantic. Paris is often referred to as the "City of Love," so I will start by searching for popular restaurants in Paris.

I will perform a web search to find a list of popular restaurants in Paris.
Experiencing an internal server error while trying to search for popular restaurants in Paris. I will try the search again to see if the issue resolves.

Unfortunately, I encountered another internal server error while trying to search for popular restaurants in Paris. It seems there might be an issue with the search functionality at the moment. Since I am unable to retrieve the required information, I will have to give up and restart the task.

I will now call the Finish function to indicate that I am unable to proceed further.

Given that the previous search for popular restaurants in Paris failed, I will try a different approach. Instead of directly searching for restaurants, I will first find a list of the most romantic cities in Europe and then search for popular restaurants in the top one.

I will perform a web search to find the most romantic cities in Europe.

children.description:
{"return_type": "give_answer", "final_answer": "Here are some popular restaurants in Florence, one of the most romantic cities in Europe:
1. Iyo Iyo
2. Banki Ramen
3. Il Cuore
4. En Cucina Casalinga GIapponese
5. Ristorante Taj Palace
6. Ristorante Il Magnifico
7. Tripperia Vegana Tan8
8. Gucci Osteria da Massimo Bottura

These restaurants offer a variety of cuisines and dining experiences, perfect for a romantic trip to Florence."}

function.name: location_for_g_search
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "g_search", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "The Location API lets you search for supported Google search locations. You can pass the `location_name` returned by the Location API as the `location_name` parameter and set the `location_parameters_auto` value to true in a Search API query to retrieve se"

function.name: search_for_g_search
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "g_search", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Get Real-time Search Result Page"

q.description: The parameter defines the query you want to search. You can use anything that you would use in a regular Google search. (e.g., `inurl:`, `site:`,` intitle:`, etc.) . You can also pass the absolute google search URL (**URL encoded**) here. For example, if y

google_domain.description: The parameter defines the Google domain to use. It defaults to google.com

cr.description: The `cr` parameter instructs Google to limit the results to websites in the specified country.

tbs.description: (to be searched) the parameter defines advanced search parameters that aren't possible in the regular query field. (e.g., advanced search for patents, dates, news, videos, images, apps, or text contents).

nfpr.description: The parameter defines the exclusion of results from an auto-corrected query that is spelled wrong. It can be set to 1 to exclude these results, or 0 to include them (default).

gl.description: The `gl` parameter determines the Google country to use for the query.

safe.description: The parameter defines the level of filtering for adult content. It can be set to active, or off (default).

filter.description: The parameter defines if the filters for 'Similar Results' and 'Omitted Results' are on or off. It can be set to 1 (default) to enable these filters, or 0 to disable these filters.

location_parameters_auto.description: If the `location_name` parameter is set to a location from the Location Endpoint, and `location_parameters_auto` is set to true (default) then the `google_domain`, `gl` and hl parameters are automatically updated to the domain, country, and language that m

location_name.description: Specifies the geographic location where the query is executed. You can enter `location_name` with free text or use the result from the `/location` endpoint for a more valid value. When you select a `location_name` and assign `true` to the `location_paramet

num.description: The parameter defines the maximum number of results to return. (e.g., 10 (default) returns 10 results, 40 returns 40 results, and 100 returns 100 results).

hl.description: The `hl` parameter determines the Google UI (display) language to return results.

lr.description: The `lr` parameter limits the results to websites containing the specified language.

start.description: `start` parameter defines the resulting offset. It skips the given number of results. It's used for pagination. (e.g., 0 (default) is the first page of results, 10 is the 2nd page of results, 20 is the 3rd page of results, etc.).

function.name: Finish
function.description: If you believe that you have obtained a result that can answer the task, please call this function to provide the final answer. Alternatively, if you recognize that you are unable to proceed with the task in the current state, call this function to restart. Remember: you must ALWAYS call this function at the end of your attempt, and the only part that will be shown to the user is the final answer, so it should contain sufficient information.

final_answer.description: The final answer you want to give the user. You should have this field if "return_type"=="give_answer"
